The company has been systematically integrating AI across Windows applications, adding features like AI-powered actions in File Explorer and image generation in Paint.The program mirrors Google's Search Labs, which provides early access to experimental search features. Microsoft's approach suggests the company is accelerating AI feature development while gathering user feedback to refine capabilities before broader deployment across the Windows ecosystem.
Article Summary: Microsoft has quietly launched Windows AI Labs, a new pilot program. The program will give select users early access to experimental artificial intelligence features. Article Title: OpenAI can use Nvidia's $100 billion investment to buy Nvidia chips back
Article Text:
The partnership's "circular investment" structure may raise regulatory concerns





OpenAI will receive up to $100 billion from Nvidia in a strategic partnership that allows the ChatGPT maker to purchase chips directly from its new investor, creating a circular flow of funds between two AI industry giants. The deal enables OpenAI to deploy 10 gigawatts of AI computing systems while ensuring Nvidia maintains both a financial stake and guaranteed customer for its hardware.The deal involves two separate but intertwined transactions, according to Reuters sources close to OpenAI. Nvidia will first invest in OpenAI for non-voting shares once the agreement is finalised, then OpenAI can use that cash to purchase Nvidia's chips and systems. This structure allows Nvidia to maintain a financial stake in the AI company while ensuring a steady customer base for its hardware.Under the agreement, Nvidia will progressively invest the $100 billion as OpenAI deploys each gigawatt of computing capacity, with the first phase targeting deployment in the second half of 2026 using Nvidia's Vera Rubin platform. The 10-gigawatt project represents enough computing power to run 4-5 million graphics processing units, equivalent to the electricity needs of over 8 million U.S.households."Everything starts with compute," said OpenAI CEO Sam Altman in a statement. "Compute infrastructure will be the basis for the economy of the future, and we will utilise what we're building with Nvidia to both create new AI breakthroughs and empower people and businesses with them at scale."The circular nature of the investment structure, where Nvidia's money flows to OpenAI and potentially returns through chip purchases, could prove to be a point of contention for the regulators. "On the one hand this helps OpenAI deliver on what are some very aspirational goals for compute infrastructure, and helps Nvidia ensure that that stuff gets built. On the other hand the 'circular' concerns have been raised in the past, and this will fuel them further," Bernstein analyst Stacy Rasgon told Reuters.The $100 billion investment could draw antitrust scrutiny from regulators who have already flagged potential competition issues in the AI sector. The partnership positions Nvidia as OpenAI's "preferred strategic compute and networking partner" while complementing existing relationships with Microsoft and other cloud providers.
Article Summary: OpenAI will receive up to $100 billion from Nvidia in a strategic partnership that allows the ChatGPT maker to purchase chips directly from its new investor. The deal enables OpenAI to deploy 10 gigawatts of AI computing systems while ensuring Nvidia maintains both a financial stake and guaranteed customer for its hardware. The circular nature of the investment structure could prove to be a point of contention for the regulators.
